titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Henry Herbert Knibbs Papers , 1874-1945
titlepage.publisher:
Department of Special Collections and University Archives
Stanford University Libraries
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1999 The Board of Trustees of Stanford University. All rights reserved.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Henry Herbert Knibbs Papers , M0188, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Writer of "western fiction." Born in Canada in 1874 and emigrated to California in 1910. Knibbs' novels are set in the West and in revolutionary Mexico. Died in 1945.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Corresponence, documents, photographs and sketches, newspaper clippings, tearsheets, and Knibbs' death mask. The areas covered include works by Henry Knibbs, including novels, short stories and poetry; biographical data on Knibbs; and works by other authors.

did.unittitle: Section I: Works By Henry H. Knibbs.
Carbon typescript, 13 pp., re old pioneer couple.

A Boy I Knew (alternately titled, Ticket Of Leave Man). Unpublished autobiography, written shortly before Knibb's death in 1945 (approximately one-third complete at that time) and edited by Turbesé Lummis Fiske. Title page fragment

did.physdesc: typescript and carbon typescript, both with autograph corrections, 131 pp.;

did.unittitle: Knibb's original final draft, unedited.Typescript with autograph corrections, pp. 1 - 173.
Revised final draft, with editor's explanatory note appearing for the first time, at p. 285. Carbon typescript, pp. 1 - 288.

did.physdesc: Typescript and carbon typescript, each 29 pp.
Fragmentary drafts, typescript with autograph corrections, 87 pp.;
Fragmentary draft, carbon typescript with autograph corrections, 72 pp.;

The Man Of the Whispering Spurs (co-authored with Turbesé Lummis Fiske).

Who Drinks the Water Of the Hassayampa...
Carbon typescript, 37 pp. ( Bedrock's Partner, Chapter 1)
Poetry, General File, Untitled, A - E. Including manuscript, typescript, carbon typescript, and tearsheet, (some with autograph correction) of the following:
Ballad Of Billy the Kid; See also Folder 4 - 42.
A Barb Of Spain; See also Folder 4 - 42.
Chang Chung Chang; See also Folder 4 - 42.
Dirge Of the Indian Mother; See also Folder 4 - 42.

I Have Builded Me A Home
If A Horse Could Talk; See also Folder 4 - 42.
Just Over the Border; See also Folder 4 - 42.
Legend Of Mournful Joe; See also Folder 4 - 42.
A Meeting in Bret Harte's Country
Ode To Anesthesia - Our Lady Of Mercy
The Plant of the Athenian Woman
Song Of the Mule; See Folder 4 - 42.
The Spanish Man; See also Folder 4 - 42.
Stallions Of the Storm; See also Folder 4 - 42.
That Was Maw; See also Folder 4 - 42.
Including one on architecture; and one with start of autograph manuscript autobiography,
General File, unidentified, A - M. Including letters to, from, or about the following:
AFG Literary Agency, 1937 - 1939(7): See Folder 6 - 61. Elmo, Ann
American Society For the Prevention Of Cruelty To Animals, 1938(2).
Blue Book magazine, 1934 - 1935(2); See also McCall Corporation.
Doubleday, Doran, and Co.,: See Folder 6 - 65.
E. P. Dutton and Co., Inc., 1948
Heckelmann, Charles N. 1948(2); See also Popular Library.
Knibbs, Ida Julia (wife of HHK): See Folder 6 - 72.
Knibbs, Olive (sister of HHK): See Folder 6 - 73.
Knibbs, Sara (mother of HHK): See Folder 6 - 74.
General File, N - Z, including letters to, from, or about, the following:
Correspondence re Pericles' Honeymoon error, 1933:See Folder 6 - 77.
Random House, Inc., publishers: See Folder 6 - 80.
Rhodes, Rosemary (Mrs. Eugene Manlove): See Folder 6 - 82.
The Saturday Evening Post: See Folder 6 - 83.
Teaboldt, Harrie and Mae, n.d.:See Folder 6 - 85.
Van Der Veer, Judy: See Folder 6 - 86.
Who's Who In the Western Hemisphere, 1943.

note.p: ( Note: Dates listed are of first and last year, and are not inclusive Figures in parentheses indicate number of items; if no such figure is given, there is only one letter.
Most letter of 1945, and all 1946 on, are to and from Turbesé Lummis Fiske, in her capacity as administratrix of Henry Knibb's estate.)

did.unittitle: Correspondence re the error in Pericles Honeymoon, 1933(21).
HHK's parents marriage license and certificate, photostat.
Assignment of copyright for Fragile: Use No Hooks, April 1936.
Contract with the McCall Corporation for a short story, September 28, 1934.
Newspaper clippings, 1909 - 1945(c. 100); mostly on Henry Knibbs or reviews of his works.
Material read at Henry Knibbs's memorial service.
Section V: Works By Others Than Henry Knibbs
Ford, Robert A. Duckworth, short stories, entitled:
Knibbs, Sara, autograph manuscript notebook 1929 - mostly impressions of books read; autograph manuscript recollections of family and historical events,
Knibbs, Sara, diary entitled, Next Reincarnation Or Perhaps, typescript, with autograph corrections, c. 200 pp. + "Sara's Journal", pen and ink drawings + typed poems

Sissons, Grace, And God So Near, typescript, manuscript, typescript carbon many with autograph corrections, includes drafts of chapters at various stages of completion - fragmentary, first draft, revised, and some final draft. Also included are numerous flase starts at chapters, some of whichwere later incorporated into completed chapters,
Carton of tearsheets and whole number periodicals, including the following:
(Stories and poems by Henry Knibbs) Whole Numbers:
The Lightnin Kid Western Book Magazine, 3/34,p. 4.
That Colt Pericles Sat. Eve. Post, 5/21/32,p. 12.
The Big Man's Anathema Popular Magazine, 3/17/16.
Fragile, Use No Hooks Short Stories, 4/10/29.
The Last Ride of Little Smoke Popular Magazine, 3/20/17
Pearl of the Atolls Popular Magazine, 8/20/16.
Pericles' Honeymoon ss Sat. Eve. Post, 8/19/33,p. 5.
Riders of the Stars American Magazine, 8/16.
The Snow Angel ss Popular Magazine, 12/20/29 & 1/2/30.
That Colt Pericles Sat. Eve. Post, 5/21/32pg. 12.
They Tried to Frame Yardlow ss Short Stories, 7/29.pg. 47.
Where the Ponies Come to Drink
Memorial to Gene Rhodes Sat. Eve. Post, 8/20/38,pg 21.
The Proud Sheriff by Rhodes Sat. Eve. Post, 10/1/32.pg 3.
Advertisement of H. H. K.'s Songs of the Lost Frontier.
